alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 10:43AM CDT until April 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting La Salle, Bureau and Putnam Counties. Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at Ottawa. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 464.0 feet, Backwater causes the Fox River to reach bankfull near St. Elizabeth Medical Center in Ottawa. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 461.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest near 463 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 463.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected this evening.
